fix unicode exceptions.

Replace k8s cronjob with a custom one.
Using a user account for scheduling backups does not work across namespaces because a service account is created per namespace.
So I implemented cronjob logic and recurrent backup schedule into operator.

When owner is deleted, and resource is not found, don't reconcile it

Refactor backup cronjob
This pull request closes #85
Fix metrics exporter user restriction to localhost

Sidecar dependency inversion
fixes #259 

partially related with #291

Node controller
Or pod controller.
A new controller that takes the responsibility of the sidecar container. Now the initialization is done by the controller, the operator connects to the pod and configures the MySQL to replicate from the current master. Also, it's responsible to create the `sys_operator.readiness` table, once created the readiness probe will succeed and the pod is ready.
Quick fix for backup and runtime error when .spec.replicas is not specified

Integrate and test PSP
@surajssd added support for psp (#5). I did few tests and update the psp and dockerfile to not run as root user.
Fix how restores are done and improve how master is chosen
Add permissions to orchestrator user to read pt-heartbeat table

Merge orchestrator and operator charts
addresses #330 and #331

Fix wordpress install and mount environments configs
Closes #35

Style formatting
Fixes the following:
- Consolidates model interfaces to a single "src/Models" import
- Standardizes Prettier configuration to match linter
- Replaces package lock with yarn lock for faster module resolution
- Formats almost every component to meet Prettier default style guide settings

At heart, I just ran a formatter against every file individually and committed these results. I replaced Model imports with a shared "src/Models" since I have exported every model in the index.ts file.

Add package lock file
We're missing a package lock file. This is just the generation of such file and the fixture of the Material UI core package to version 3.12.0 until #169 is resolved. Sorted the linter rules as well so we can find them quicker

Model imports
Fixes imports of model types, moving everything else to Typescript declaration files. Will make it easier to interact with model types in the future.

Using Redux Actions
This lays the foundation for the Redux work I want to prepare before working on caching API requests. Converts the existing action/reducer structure to use [redux-actions](https://github.com/redux-utilities/redux-actions). We want to consolidate hardcoded strings into an easily accessible list, and namespace actions because we tend to use them around each other.

Add Material Loader and nametag support
This pull request features the following:
- Adds support for the Material Loader from Three (finally!) and fixes some grouping issues.
- Replaces TGA ball diffuse file with easier PNG and material map.
- Reduces the material count for the player from 6 to 2.
- Removed the absurdly large octane model
    - **Note:** These player models are complete, meaning they do not yet support separate animation from the wheels. This support should be added as a fit & finish release during beta.
- Support for player nametags that float above each car. Features similar design to in-game, although edges are rounded and not sharp.

Fixes #169
Fixes #169 
Addresses the following:
- Updates Material UI Core, moment, and React versions
- Sets "allowSyntheticDefaultImports" to true to allow defaulted imports from moment package. See https://github.com/moment/moment/issues/4397 in response to https://github.com/dmtrKovalenko/date-io/issues/2

Move away from react-scripts-ts
The new `react-scripts` package now supports Typescript, and fixes many security vulnerabilities not addressed in `react-scripts-ts`. This support is now first-party, but it lacks support for aliased imports and namespaces that we were taking advantage of earlier (thanks, Babel!). Hence, this PR includes the proper changes to address issues which blocked compilation.

Add larger field object
This will likely be replaced by a lower-res model since the larger is 16.2 MB

Migrate to Typescript
Working on producing an accurate definition file before breaking apart the index file into several functions. Made this PR to track progress but also might need help from @dschonholtz and @DarkAce65 to complete the work. The `three-gltf-loader` is not stable and could prove to be a pain.
Progress trackers:
- [x] Migrate `ar.js` library to typescript definition file
- [x] Enforce `noImplicitAny` requirement
- [x] Declare `three-gltf-loader` module support
- [x] Export model-loading functionality into separate async/await promise function

Reorders error that is thrown
The current ordering throws an internal server error. This is a quick fix.

Hide predictions tab if predictions do not exist
As the title states, this PR hides all hints of the predictions tab if we aren't able to pull the predictions in (404 error).

Filter the actual embed URL of HubSpot widgets
The filter currently blocks the entirety of HubSpot's app, but this update targets just the embeddable widget. I haven't updated the compressed archives `app.zip` and `firefox_app.zip` but they should probably receive some love as well (since those filter lists seem to be out of date)

Use GLB assets
Removes and reorganizes all assets to live inside the `archive` directory, replacing with just three `.glb` files: Ball, Field, and Octane. The Octane currently does not have wheels, since we will need the wheel asset separate for animation purposes, so when that time comes we can model the wheels as well.

Asset cleaning
Removed the lights and camera objects from each of the models

Add concatenation
Adds `concat` operator which merges indexed iterables and joins keyed iterables.

Add new octane model and texture pack
Adds new Octane ZXR model + textures. The base model `Octane ZXR` has an orange texture and the new `Octane_ZXR_Mat` folder contains an alternate texture that we can load for blue players

Update models from Replay Viewer hackathon
This PR will contain all updates made to the shared assets repo made during the May 11, 2019 hackathon

Hackathon work
Adds memoization and import settings for player models. Uses new blue vs. orange car loaders and adjusts scaling to match the given model. The goal was to ensure that all models used the same dimensions so that we don't have to play scale guess and check when initializing every time.

Cleaning up loading and managing
## Issue
#10 

## Context
Per this issue, this work relates v1 preparation. Particularly, this PR contains an overhaul of the preexisting game manager to remove all references from one manager to another. Instead, managers can _and should_ only be accessed via their `getInstance` class methods. This PR also fixes up the sloppy mess that was model loading and initialization

Clean-up and control addition
Replaces old usage of `styled-components` with various `@material-ui` libraries (core, labs, and styles). Also using this PR for fit & finish tasks like re-positioning the wheels correctly on player models and ensuring that items don't clip through each other incorrectly due to sizing.
## Fix hitlist:
- [x] #4
- [x] #8
- [x] #11 
- [x] #12

## Preview
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10366495/57904725-0515cc00-7842-11e9-8e14-5d41c4b8e7b6.png)

Add camera controls
- Rewrote some of the camera manager to support both `PerspectiveCamera` and `OrthographicCamera` three.js objects
- Added buttons to toggle between camera views (see preview)
- Fixed a small bug with the layout of the score board
- Added Grid layout to docs demo for better separation of controls

![a32b66e03e18d15d8e14a2fa4c4faccc](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10366495/57967158-43d28180-7929-11e9-9b46-2d305f758007.gif)

Fix binary imports
Old build had an issue with missing chunks, so I replaced the `awesome-typescript-loader` with a babel loader that has support for dynamic imports. This new setup, along with the delicate file manager configuration, means we can easily target binary files so long as they are _always_ top-level in the `assets/models` directory of SharedAssets.

Replay viewer v2
Adds external library [`replay-viewer`](https://github.com/SaltieRL/WebReplayViewer) and specialized playback tools to the "Replay Viewer" tab inside of replays

Add shadows and documentation
Makes a number of minor adjustments but most importantly fixes outdated documentation and adds shadow maps to the field:

- Fixes #17 
- Fixes an issue where demolished players would clip under the map and continue displaying
- Fixes an issue where rendering the replay viewer twice would cause the time speed to double

Debounce calls to save computation time
Debounces a handful of calls that otherwise do not need to be instant. Saves us a bit of performance.

Update replay-viewer
Bump replay-viewer version to 0.2.7

Bump the replay viewer version
Upgrades the [`replay-viewer` version to 0.2.8](https://github.com/SaltieRL/WebReplayViewer/releases/tag/v0.2.8), bringing in some much-needed performance fixes and bug fixes. Also adds asset loader:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10366495/59173046-1092a500-8b19-11e9-8d74-f0b3eb688260.png)

Fix a number of bugs and add fullscreen viewer
Fixes #32

In this version `0.3.0`, we add a few features and bug fixes:

- Moved all camera updates to new event bus system. Will eventually migrate all events to global event bus
- Added full screen toggle support. Note that this also increases the size of the canvas (and requires hardware capable of supporting this larger render space)
- Fixed an issue where sprites would display too small in orthographic views

Add all (five) orthographic camera views
Fixes #19 

Adds the following four orthographic camera corners:

- Blue Left
- Blue Right
- Orange Left
- Orange Right

and a viewing angle from the very top of the field (fixes #34)

![Screen Shot 2019-06-21 at 12 01 53 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10366495/59935823-a503de00-941c-11e9-9ad2-354a07885fb9.png)
![Screen Shot 2019-06-21 at 12 00 56 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10366495/59935834-a8976500-941c-11e9-8dd0-b33354c6f37b.png)

Fix the scoreboard calculations
Fixes #46. Since we [fill in -100](https://github.com/SaltieRL/DistributedReplays/blob/5ecf61651d79912358c451f0a7e14d7ae2aa454e/backend/blueprints/spa_api/service_layers/replay/replay_positions.py#L45) when we don't have values for a frame, this breaks the calculation.

Update to 0.5.1
Includes `lodash` updates from `4.17.11` to `4.17.14`

Update replay viewer
Bumps `replay-viewer` version and audits some packages

Return elapsed time based on current frame
Passes the elapsed time in milliseconds to each callback function

Pass delta into frame callbacks
The `getDelta` function is unsafe, since it can only be called in one spot and impacts performance of the rest of the app. This makes that function call private and moves it into the FrameEvents so all subscribers can take advantage of the realtime delta.

Ignore the workspace.xml file
**Reasons for making this change:**

The workspace.xml file contains Android Studio layout properties, open tabs, and many others. This file will mess up your configuration if you aren't careful.
For the second change, the Dalvik VM was renamed to ART with Android API 21

**Links to documentation supporting these rule changes:** 

_workspace.xml_: https://intellij-support.jetbrains.com/hc/en-us/articles/206544839-How-to-manage-projects-under-Version-Control-Systems
_ART_: https://source.android.com/devices/tech/dalvik/

Update Android.gitignore
**Reasons for making this change:**

The libraries folder makes change lists too cluttered and is generated during a gradle build

**Links to documentation supporting these rule changes:** 

https://intellij-support.jetbrains.com/hc/en-us/articles/206544839-How-to-manage-projects-under-Version-Control-Systems

Zeppelin audit fixes
In response to: https://medium.com/@ZeppelinOrg/abe43b887664

Safe Emergency withdrawal
The method *emergencyWithdrawal* allows the owner of the engine to withdrawal ERC20 tokens sent by accident. Keeps track of all lender balances, so it's impossible to withdraw funds that belong to a lender.

Resolves #6 

* Added method to calculate required funds to lend a loan
* Updated Oracle ABI
* Display required funds and current balance in 'dialog-insufficient-founds'

* Refactor handle lend to use async/await
* Fix retrieve Oracle data
* Tweaked dialog

- Add `Provider` class, to inject web3 and relayer

Use staticcall for dependencies
Replaces the list of bytes32[] ids by a single staticcall, this allows for more flexible dependencies, for example:

- Cross-wallets dependencies
- OR dependencies
- Dependencies not related to intents Ej: Account has 10 ETH

Modular execution unit
- Split relay logic from signature validation, this simplifies the Marmo core logic
- Marmo relays a delegatecall, not a call, this allows to upgrade and add features to already created wallets, (multiple intents with one signature, pay gas with tokens, approve and call, more or less relayer malleability, etc)
- Scheme for implementations, the first 32 bytes is the ID of the Intent, the rest of the call is the data for the relayer.

Modular execution unit
- Implement staticall dependency
- Implement call Intent (Modular execution unit) https://github.com/ripio/marmo-contracts/pull/11
- Add E2E tests

Add loan callback
The loan callback gets called during the end of the "lend" process, the callback contract can reject the operation or it can perform any other operation within the limit of 300000 of gas.

Increase range of provided rates
- Use two independent arrays for provide multiple, avoid uint96 limit
- Increase BASE to 10 ** 36

sketches-core-0.13.4
From the sketches-core release notes:
"0.13.4 May 14, 2019: Fix Theta Direct Union Bug, alternate path.
It turns out there were two different code paths that would reveal the Direct Union Bug. This fixes the alternate, but seldom used path, which wasn't caught in the previous release."

I am not sure this code path is used in Druid. So this update may or may not be of significance.
By the way, did anyone verify that the previous update to 0.13.3 really fixed the Theta sketch regression (#7619)?

locking in Theta sketch buffer aggregator
Added locking to theta buffer aggregator, factored out common locking code.
It seems to me that this locking was missing from the very beginning, but was not quite necessary so far.
As I understand it might become important in the future or is already needed in some particular use cases. This was discussed in several pull requests.
For instance:
https://github.com/apache/incubator-druid/pull/6581
https://github.com/apache/incubator-druid/pull/5002
https://github.com/apache/incubator-druid/pull/5148

[add data] Move processor initialization into constructors
### Summary:

Before this PR, the pipeline class was responsible for initializing the model state for each processor when returning from a later wizard step.
After this PR, each processor class is responsible for importing state from an oldProcessor which is passed into the processor's constructor. Each processor now only imports data for properties that it needs whereas before it would import all properties from the old object.
This is a code refactoring in preparation for editable pipelines, and there should be no functional changes.

[add data] server refactoring
### Summary

In preparation for the editable pipelines, I needed to add esToKibana functionality to the processor converters. In the process of doing that, I noticed that we had some inconsistencies on the organization of the server code. I did some refactoring.

Add tests for decompress-zip to check strip functionality
Made slight change to zip module to make the filters argument optional.
Added tests to exercise the strip functionality of the decompress-zip library. This currently works correctly in my forked version of decompress-zip, but still does not work in the latest version of decompress-zip (v0.3.0)

Tests pass if you use the @BigFunger/decompress-zip dependency, but if you switch to the decompress-zip dependency, they will fail.

Remove pipelines from ingest endpoint, and import csv wizard
This PR removes any mention of pipelines from the existing CSV Import wizard and the Ingest POST endpoint/service.
There are going to be a lot of changes to that structure as pipeline functionality is merged back into master. So removing it here will make the pipeline PR processor much more smooth.
Also, it doesn't really make sense for this logic to be intertwined with the existing live csv import functionality because it only adds complexity to that logic, and is currently impossible for it to be executed.

Adds disabled, visible, and tooltip properties to section class/template
Previously, when sections in management needed to be hidden/shown/enabled/disabled, this was done by modifying the collection of sections initially created by a registry.
This is slightly hacky and does not provide a clear workflow.
To address this, I added `enabled` and `visible` properties to the `section` class, along with accessor functions `hide`, `show`, `enable`, and `disable`.

Add breadcrumb-page-title to management-app
Summary: The `bread-crumbs` component allows for the consumer to pass in a `page-title` value which is appended as the final breadcrumb in the chain. This PR adds a scope argument to the `management-app` to take advantage of it.
Changes: Adds a `breadcrumbPageTitle` scope argument to the `kbn-management-app` directive with two-way binding, and passes the value along to the `bread-crumbs` directive.

Fix a bug in parsing 005 arguments
This fixes a bug which causes 005 arguments to be split in the wrong place and therefore parsed incorrectly
Example:

```
arguments: ['TARGMAX=NAMES', '1,LIST:1,KICK:1,WHOIS:1,PRIVMSG:4,NOTICE:4,ACCEPT:,MONITOR: EXTBAN=$,&acjmorxz| CLIENTVER=3.0 :are supported by this server']
```

Fix a NICK handling bug in event
Due to the NICK syntax (`nick!user@host NICK :newnick`), `event.target` would be set to `:newnick`. This change will check if event.target starts with a `:` and if so, will remove it.

bugfix/answer-question-foreign-key
Proposed "first migration step" for making the Answer model to Question model relation ForeignKey, instead of ManyToManyField. First adds a ForeignKey field in Answer model, and modifies answer/api.py to account for that change. Includes a migration script to copy over the ManyToManyField 'answers' , in question/models.py, into the new ForeignKey field 'question' in answer/models.py.

[Metricbeat][Docker] Docker cpu norms
This PR implements the proposal for `docker.cpu.*.norm.pct` fields described on https://github.com/elastic/beats/issues/13343.
### How to test it
1. Enable Docker Module and cpu metricset specifically.
2. Run Metricbeat and check that all the new normalised fields are present:

- [ ] kernel.norm.pct
- [ ] system.norm.pct
- [ ] user.norm.pct
- [ ] total.norm.pct
- [ ] core.*.norm.pct

Disable `add_kubernetes_metadata` if no matchers found
Fixes https://github.com/elastic/beats/issues/13705

As far as I can see, the problem with Beats other than Filebeat and Metricbeat is that they do not have default matchers. In the [docs](https://github.com/elastic/beats/issues/13705) is mentioned that Filebeat enables `logs_path` matcher by default (Metricbeat, enables `field` matcher).
I'm not sure if we should add default matchers for all other Beats.
I think that ignoring that error and just disable the processor should be ok.

Compare event by event in `testdata` framework to avoid sorting problems
In `testdata` we currently assert the final lists of events, which need to be sorted otherwise the assertion will fail. This leads to problematic situations when one want to use `remove_fields_from_comparison` in long lists of events since the sorting are not working properly.
In this regard, it might be safer in the long run to compare event by event the lists, as we do in https://github.com/elastic/beats/blob/8ce4b7c269cb688770637d74388a80cbc452d415/metricbeat/helper/prometheus/ptest/ptest.go#L105

Add Process ID of each daemon to log.
If a test fails within the CI test suite, it is difficult to correlate the test that failed with a particular instance of a daemon's log. Although PIDs are available in daemon.log, each daemon's log is a large concatenated collection of invocations. This patch adds a Process ID to each log to help identify specific log instances.

Add support for out-of-memory tests.
This patch defines wrappers for the system malloc and free functions. These automatically override the runtime library's malloc/free. The global variable mockMallocFailCounter can be set to a value to cause a malloc to fail - the counter is decremented for each malloc encountered, and when it reaches zero it will fail that malloc (it will return NULL).

Add install prefix variable to top-level Makefile, so that installation prefix can be specified at build time. Default is set to /usr/local. Override with 'make INSTALL_PREFIX=/path/to/install/to.

Implement Server Events.
These changes are intended to provide an API for server-side applications to receive automatically generated Event notifications upon client registration, client update and client deregistration. This allows the application to respond as necessary and eliminates the necessity to poll ListClients.

Enable esphttpd component by default.
The README says "make sure you enable the esphttpd component" which is good advice but I did miss this the first time (and it wasn't obvious to me where the component was at first glance). Since this project is a demo of the esphttpd library, I think it would be better if it built "out of the box", so I've added an `sdkconfig.defaults` file that simply enables the esphttpd component. Now the user can just type `make` and it will build completely.
One less hoop for users to jump through perhaps.

Fix log tag comparison when using variable tags (such as non-literals). (IDFGH-897)
Setting a log level by tag does not work when the tag is provided as a variable (rather than a literal string). This is because there is an incorrect equality performed in `esp_log_level_set()`. A copy of the tag is made but the contents of this copy is not compared - instead the tag _pointers_ are compared, which does not work for non-literal tags.
Refer to this forum post: https://www.esp32.com/viewtopic.php?f=13&t=9004

:bug: Fix attempt to insert error response into database

Add Links to Related Learning Objects on the Details Page
## Features
This PR adds two listings to the details page: 1.) Learning objects that include the learning object you are currently viewing, 2.) Learning objects included in the learning object you are currently viewing.
Additionally, a download button was added to learning object components for easy downloading from any listing.
## Refactors
The details component has been updated so that it's sole functionality is fetching the learning object being viewed on the page, and forwarding that data to its components. This brought about several new components for the module, and led to refactoring throughout them.

Remove unused password field validation
The logic left for validating the password field when editing the profile created a bug that caused the inputs in the edit profile to not populate with data until the first key stroke occurred. This was caused by an error with a ViewChild reference not being defined. The logic has been removed, and the component now uses the Take Until Destroyed pattern.

Remove unused password field validation
The logic left for validating the password field when editing the profile created a bug that caused the inputs in the edit profile to not populate with data until the first key stroke occurred. This was caused by an error with a ViewChild reference not being defined. The logic has been removed, and the component now uses the Take Until Destroyed pattern.

Filter out unpackageable files
The archive that is now sent to the user will only contain files that are "packageable."

Remove unused code
The datastore is no longer a needed type for the Gateway as the app currently serves only as a proxy to other services. Unused dependencies were removed from the package, and updates were made to certain transitive dependencies to remove potential security risks.

Remove download button
Learning Object Components no longer show the download indicator while the object is still loading. This cleans up the placeholder animation and prevents non-responsive UI interactions.
:arrow_up: Update clark-entity to 3.1.0 and clark-schema to 1.0.2

Recently Released
The featured component will now show the last 5 learning objects that have been released. The yellow status indicator in the dashboard has also been removed since all learning objects that are not released will now have a lock on them. This allows the user to still see if their learning object is submitted or not.
Dependent on Cyber4All/learning-object-service#107

Download authorization
In order to allow user's on the whitelist to download locked content, a check has been added to fetch from the whitelist.
Learning objects with locked children will also not download the children in the bundle anymore.

Ops/cpu optimization
This PR adds the gulp-watch library to be used in favor of gulp's built in watch function. This is done to use better practices than gulp natively does for monitoring files in the file system.
There has also been a delay added to nodemon to fix the issue where it restarts anywhere from 8-24 times on one file save.
Additionally, a flag has been added to check if the gulp process is running in a docker container, and to run in the legacy file mode if it is.

CPU Optimization for Gulp Watch and Nodemon
This PR adds the gulp-watch library to be used in favor of gulp's built in watch function. This is done to use better practices than gulp natively does for monitoring files in the file system.
There has also been a delay added to nodemon to fix the issue where it restarts anywhere from 8-24 times on one file save.
Additionally, a flag has been added to check if the gulp process is running in a docker container, and to run in the legacy file mode if it is.

CPU Optimization for Gulp Watch and Nodemon
This PR adds the gulp-watch library to be used in favor of gulp's built in watch function. This is done to use better practices than gulp natively does for monitoring files in the file system.

Fix collection filter doesn't select from URL
The collection filter was not applied to learning objects when loading the app with the filter applied via query param in the URL.

Fix showing contributors when there aren't any
The contributors section was showing up on the details page with no users listed out if the learning object didn't have any contributors. Now it will only show up if there are contributors.

Abstract publishing to a module & in-memory datastore
The ability for an authorized user to toggle a learning object's published flag has been abstracted to its own module. This module contains each architectural level of the system for the given functionality, and simply plugs into the AuthRouteDriver as middleware.
The tests/in-memory datastore branch was merged into this PR.
Changes in that branch include:
* Create Mock Datastore
* Create const to store mock objects used in unit testing
* Create Mock S3 Driver
* Refactor Library Interactor to be a driver that implements an interface
* Create Mock Library Driver

Only show released to non-admins
The browse page has been updated to only show objects that have been released to users that are not on the whitelist. Since users now can only browse non-released objects, the counter in the searchbar has also been updated.

Capitalize LO Types
To maintain consistency across the platform, I propose that we keep the types capitalized.

Fix no standard outcome sources
Since `HTTPClient` parses the response object, only the parsed body is passed into the promise chains. This means the response is just an array of sources, and all network info like the `ok` property is stripped off.

Optimize total query
When working with cursors in MongoDB, a limit value of 0 is treated as providing no limit at all (see https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/reference/method/cursor.limit/#zero-value). For this reason, instead of setting a limit of 0 on the home page query which is looking for only the total number of objects, a limit of 1 has been set. This allows the operation to be performed much faster. This also greatly reduces load on the API, increasing the speed at which the client populates the number of learning objects into the search bar.

Dynamically fetch collection data
The collection service will now store the results of the get collections route in an instance variable for quick access by other components, and the details page, browse page, and learning object components now all use the dynamic data instead of hard coded values.
Resolves #451

Fix generic error messages
HTTPClient changes the response structure for catch statements. They no longer contain a body property.

Bring Back Collections
This PR aims to:
1. Update the forsaken collections page in the app to work with the API changes to collections in CLARK
2. Add collections to the home page so that they are more prominent for the user

The new collections page should:
1. Display the name of the collection
2. Provide a link to the collection's homepage (hosted off-site)
3. Provide a description of the collection in rich text
4. Provide a link to the browse page, filtered by the collection

Additionally, counters have been added to the home page to show how many learning objects are released, and how many are pending review.

Add Academic Levels to Details Page
Adds academic levels to the details page, listed out in the same fashion that they appear in the builder. However, instead of being selectable, they act as links to the browse page with the level applied as a filter.
Resolves #445

Test Submission Logic
This PR aims to provide unit tests that cover the interactor-level functionality in the Submission Module.
New mocks have been added to provide easily accessible learning objects in various states.

Remove Zero Counter from Folders
Folders that contain only other folders had previously read "0 Items" due to not directly containing a file. These folders now make no mention of the items contained inside.

Fix failing builds
Having TypeScript files outside of the source directory causes the build process to output the wrong directory structure. Instead of outputing just the source directory, the root level of dist will contain the folders src and test. Moving test into the src folder fixes this.

Restore Clark Card Functionality
Clark Cards now can be printed for anyone, by anyone. Clicking the button in the user's profile opens a new tab with the generated PDF.

Refactor to modules
This PR removes the functionality of toggling the published status for a learning object in the admin dashboard. The published flag is currently being phased out in favor of status values that show where a learning object is in the submission process.
This PR also adds tests for checking if the whitelist functionality is working.

Fix organization suggestions blocking next button
When a full list of organizations is returned, it covers the next button. If a user does not select an organization from the list, but instead types it out, they are unable to click the next button. This PR adds a function that clears the list when the user is no longer focused on the input.

Only show featured collections
By having a filter to exclude specific collections from the home page, any new collections by default are featured. This logic has been inverted.

Require license acceptance to submit Learning Objects to Collections
To submit a learning object to a collection, the user must now manually accept the license.

Fix Single FIle Downloads
Errors in the single file download route were causing the learning object service to crash. The problem was that an error was being thrown in the stream, after it was opened to S3 and being piped to the client. This PR adds a function to send a HEAD request to S3 to verify that the file is accessible before opening the stream.
Additionally, some files did not have a `fileType` set which was resulting in the RouteHandler attempting to set a mimeType of `null`. This is not supported by the express API and was throwing an error.

Remove error report for canceled downloads
If the client cancels a download that is in progress, the file stream coming from S3 will throw an error after a timeout window. This PR adds a check to prevent this from being reported.
Resolves #148

Download License with Learning Object
This PR adds the Creative Commons 3.0 license to each download. Additionally, error reporting has been added to the download process.

Remove Unused Collection Service
The duplicate collection service was removed, and the related route entry deleted.

Abstract Collection Operations to a Feature Module
The collection operations have been moved to their own module that defines all of the routes, the datastore interface, and interactor methods for all collection operations in the service.

Use Access Groups instead of the Whitelist
This PR eliminates the use of the whitelist in favor if the access groups that are listed on each user. All previously whitelisted users are now considered to be "reviewers."

Fix Cannot read property 'includes' of undefined
The `accessGroups` property is not defined for users who do not have any access groups (the default user). This PR prevents the service from treating accessGroups as an array when it is in fact undefined.

Add In-memory MongoDB Server to Tests
This PR adds an in-memory MongoDB server to the testing environment so that tests can be written against queries.
This should allow us to identify any issues with our query syntax, especially when updating versions of the MongoDB driver.

Feature/collection access groups
This PR expands the business logic for updating a Learning Object to allow editors, collection leads, and curators access as well.
The admin route now redirects to the default route, and all authorization is handled there.
#### Other Updates
- The transpilation target for TypeScript was updated to ES2017 in order to provide the `includes` function on the Array prototype, as used by all logic to check `accessGroups` on the `UserToken`
- The submission tests were failing due to a misplaced await. This has now been fixed.
Resolves #166

Add TU Logo and Philosophy to Home Page
This PR adds the Towson logo to the footer of the site, next to the NSA logo. Additionally, it adds a new section to the Home Page that covers the philosophy of CLARK.
Resolves #526

Remove Unused Modules
This PR removes unused modules from the package, and refactors the tests to use only jest instead of a mixture of jest and chai. Additionally, it removes unit tests for the LibraryInteractor that were coupled to the DataStore.
This PR reduces the total number of node modules from 40228 to 32942.

Fix Cannot read property 'includes' of undefined
This PR fixes an error preventing downloads in production for any user that does not have the `accessGroups` property. Faulty logic in a conditional made it so that if accessGroups was undefined, it would still check to see if accessGroups included the string `reviewer`.
Test cases have been added to verify the solution fixes the problem, and `hasAccess` was converted from an async function to a normal function since there was no async code.

Fix review pending banner not showing
Due to a recent change in the authorization logic, the review pending banner no longer shows for Learning Objects that are not released. This is due to the fact that the `isReleased` variable was being set based on the user's privilege level and not the Learning Object's status.
This PR updates the component logic related to download access and release status.

Fix revise button showing after logout
When an admin or editor logged out of the app while on the details page, the revise button remained visible on the page. This PR updates the Action Panel to check the user's access privileges each time the authorization group changes in the AuthService.

Replace C.L.A.R.K. with CLARK
Text on the home page has been updated to use the non-acronym name of CLARK, which is in line with the updated branding guidelines.
Resolves #539

Add comma to fix sentence grammar
An error with grammar has been fixed in the download popup.
Resolves #530

Hotfix/bcrypt#99
This PR moves us to a JavaScript port of bcrypt to *hopefully* avoid the issues we have been facing with it crashing deployments. A test has also been added to check that bcrypt is working so that this will be checked in each build.
Several other issues have been addressed across several files, including improper use of types, bad references, and broken API calls.
Needs Cyber4All/clark-client#474
Resolves #99

Add areas route
A route was added that returns all areas for all outcomes in the system, allowing a client to filter results by an area.

Fix Status Error
Some refactoring was done to hide the endpoint data formats from the component. The service now returns a `Message` type to the component for use.
The service now throws an Error on purpose if the response from the endpoint is malformed, as compared to previously returning undefined which caused a runtime error since the client tried to access `.length` of undefined.

Fix changing status on an object deletes contributors
Previously, the entire Learning Object was being sent up in the patch request. This was problematic because it was not a fully qualified Learning Object, but instead was a Learning Object Summary - meaning there were no contributors or children attached. Because of this, it was sending up the information it had, which was an empty array.
Now, only the status and id are sent up.
Closes #23

Service returns 500 when a user is not found
This PR adds error handling so that if a user does not exist, the route to load their learning objects returns a 404 instead of a 500.
Additionally, two new types, `ServiceError` and `ResourceError`, were introduced so that we can have a semantic understanding of whether or not an error has been caught within another layer of the application. This allows us to tailor the way we handle the error in any given context, as well as easily filter all outbound responses to ensure internal service information is not leaked.
Several promise rejections in async functions were also converted to throw statements.

Fix StatStore Database undefined
The UserStatStore was not being provided with a valid database reference, and was throwing an internal server error.

Add User Stats
The user stats components and service request have been added back into the application due to support for the service request being restored in Cyber4All/user-service#113

Fix bad function call
Refactoring of the Single File Download business logic was missed when refactoring the the datastore method's function signature.
I have updated it to now use the new function signature. I've set it to request the full object, as I believe that without that the file information does not come through.
Resolves #223

:ambulance: Fix broken search for reviewers/curators
Faulty logic in the mongo driver's query for reviewers/curators was replacing the search query with the access privileges, thus showing every object a reviewer/curator had access to see on each search.

Fix bad refresh token request
The client app was making a request to refresh the user's token even when the token was invalid. Now the app first validates the token before it attempts to refresh it. The refresh operation only happens if the token is valid. If the token is not valid, it will prompt the user to sign in again.
This preserves the operation of automatically updating the user information stored in the token if the token is valid, while adding appropriate handling if it is not valid.
While the request is made, a loading spinner is shown to the user:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14933100/53068353-2ca90280-34a6-11e9-9e49-a55ee7a0b087.png)

Closes #607

Fix invalid download access for reviewers, curators, and editors
The access check had not been updated to allow reviewers/curators of a given collection to have download access. Unit tests have also been added to check for this functionality.

Add library stats route to unless block
The library stats needs to be added to the unless block of the JWT middleware to allow public access.
I suggest that in the future, we consider removing the JWT middleware here for any route that serves as a proxy to another service, and just allow that service to handle authentication.

Add Library Stats Request back into Client
This reverts commit fb2290401839b0b4c1cd40261f58779330291cd0, which originally introduced this feature.
With this in place, that saves and downloads counters will update with live data, vs the previous snapshot data being fetched from Learning Object service.

Email verification tests
The goal of this PR is to write tests for the two flags in the EmailVerifiedComponent. In order to do that, the current test runner needed to be fixed as it failed to run most tests. Therefore, this PR completely removes the config and dependencies for Jasmine and Karma, and configures Jest to run all Angular tests.
Additionally, the Angular CLI will no longer output progress information while building the application in CI.
This article was very helpful in understanding tests in Angular: https://codecraft.tv/courses/angular/unit-testing/asynchronous/

Upgrade to Gulp 4

Remove file solutions filter
The library service was still filtering out solutions files from downloads, even though other parts of the system have done away with the attempt to enforce the filtering.
This brought some confusion to users, as the solutions files showed in the file preview but were not in the archive when the Learning Object was downloaded.

Fix broken links
This PR adds URL encoding to the learning object name field in the Included In component. This is done because we allow `/` characters in LO names, but they break URL structures if left in plain text.

Upgrade to Gulp 4
Gulp 3 does not play nice with Node 10, so to support local development better this PR updates Gulp to version 4 - and includes the needed changes to bump the major version.

Patch PDFKit

Remove package bloat

2. Removes packages that are not references by any of our code

Fix NPM Audit Issues
This PR fixes all security issues that were being flagged by npm audit. This is done through the gulp upgrade in #283, upgrading Jest, and removing the unused gulp-watch dependency.

Fix NPM Audit Issues
This PR fixes all security issues that were being flagged by npm audit. This is done through the gulp upgrade in #283, upgrading Jest, and removing the unused gulp-watch dependency.
(This is a re-opening of #290 - I had to do some tomfoolery with rebasing to get the dependency trees to sync up)

Fix Internal Server Error on Child Modification
Passing the `username` instead of the `authorId` was causing service failure when setting or removing child Learning Objects.

Filter unreleased parents
This PR puts a temporary solution in place for unreleased parent Learning Objects showing up on the details page of their released child. For now, the parents are bing filtered out client-side, since there is quite a bit more work to be done to get the service in a position to handle the data flows outlined in Cyber4All/learning-object-service#282.

Update route structure to be more resource-oriented
Instead of using two different routes to request different versions of the same resource, it is now handled by a query parameter. This is more inline with the way that revisions are requested throughout the rest of our API.

Fix cannot filter search by Standard Outcomes
The client was sending `standardOutcomes` as a query property, while the server was expecting `standardOutcomeIDs`. In the same fashion that the page and limit properties are transformed by the route handler, I've added a transform step for this property as well.

The old ToS was merged into master, deploying an outdated policy.

Move Search Metadata Routes to Search Module
Since sources and areas are used to refine the search process, this PR moves them into the Search module and eliminates the remnants of our original layered-architecture.

Remove lingering "this" pointer
During the refactor, the interactor functions were moved from a static class to being directly exported from the module. Two calls to `this.dataStore` were not updated. This PR fixes those.

Remove unused packages
This PR removes packages not used by the service. Additionally, it moves `cors` from a `devDependency` to a `dependency`, since it is used in the production image.

Add endpoint tests for Outcomes
1. This PR removes the unused integration test stage from CI, since it is not being used and adds significant time to each build.
2. Implements jest as a test runner for the service
3. Adds tests for each route in the service

Additionally, a Facade was implemented for search, as this will help reduce the scope of the PR for moving to elasticsearch as our datastore for the search route.

Add Sentry
This PR adds error logging with Sentry to any failed request.

Run Tests in CI
This PR updates the config to run unit tests as part of CI.

Fix rating UI tries to edit a deleted rating
This PR prevents the user from running into a situation where they delete their rating and are unable to leave a new rating. This was caused by the component keeping the user's rating in memory and not resetting when it was deleted server-side.
This PR also fixes a few instances where TypeErrors were thrown because a null rating was being passed around.

Hotfix/downloads
This removes failing tests from the service, as well as the email verified check for downloading a released learning object. This allows new users to our platform to download learning objects more easily, while still enforcing that we verify emails for all contributors.

Security patches
This PR bumps the version of Jest and Angular build tools. It also removes both npm and @nguniversal/express-engine as a dependency (I couldn't figure out why npm was ever added in the first place).

Add View All back to Collections
This PR adds the View All button back to the collection details page, as it was removed with the home page refactoring.

Add debug config for vscode
This PR adds configuration to attach vs code to the chrome debugger so that developers can set breakpoints and explore the call stack.
The debugger will serve the application, so all you need to do is click play on the `ng serve` tab in the debug window (as shown here):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14933100/57098497-3e99f380-6ce8-11e9-9f49-d34592697852.png)

Then, breakpoints can be set as shown here:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14933100/57098570-6b4e0b00-6ce8-11e9-88e8-083eb12e7cbd.png)

#NoMoreConsoleLogs

Remove integration test job requirement
The integration test job was still required to deploy to production, even though it was removed. This requirement has now been removed so deployments should work again.

Require Build for Deployment
Reverts Cyber4All/outcome-suggestion-service#55 and requires build before deployment.

Add OpenID Tokens
This branch encompasses `patch/encoded-token-data`, which brings about the addition of OpenID tokens for direct to S3 uploads.
It then restructures the response payload on login, register, and refresh token to maintain backwards compatibility by maintaining the previous response type as a subset of the new response. This allows new clients to get what they need, while old clients remain unchanged.

Log the running API version on startup
This PR updates the startup log for the service to include the API version number. Previously, the package was being grabbed from the wrong directory. This has been updated to bundle the package into the dist and fetch it from that location.
Additionally, the welcome route for the "admin API" has been removed as it saw no use.

Create Shared Folder
This PR introduces a `shared` folder at `/src/shared` for all shared types, functions, and classes to live. The goal here is two-fold:
1. To reduce the sheer number of files and folders in the `src` directory
2. To have the folders located at the root of `src` oriented around **system capabilities**, so that it is easier for developers to step through the code base when looking for something specific

This PR introduces no API changes. It is just some good ol' housekeeping.

Speed Up Tests
This speeds up tests by returning the result of the `MongoDriver` disconnect function so that teardown doesn't hang as long. It also removes the integration test stage from CircleCI that was not actually running anything useful.
The test runner still hangs quite a bit after running teardown for Mongo and Node. I wasn't able to figure out why, so we'll need to keep working on that.

Test improvements fixes
Mixup with git refs made it easier to open a new branch than fix the old. This is a re-do of #323.

Remove elastic beanstalk config
We no longer deploy elastic beanstalk for hosting the service. This PR removes old config files.

Move SentryConnector to Shared
This PR moves the `SentryConnector` to the `/shared` folder and documents both the module and the use of the `reportError` function.

Test Updates that Release Learning Objects
This PR adds test cases to assert that when a Learning Object update request is made by an editor or an admin with `status: released` included, the service responds with a 200 OK.

Clean Irrelevant Data from Elasticsearch Indexing Request
This PR removes irrelevant data from the request to index a Learning Object into Elasticsearch. It also adds unit tests for the `ElasticSearchPublishingGateway` to ensure expectations of indexed data are met as the service evolves.
EDIT: I'm not sure why commits from my last PR, that are in master, are here. Please ignore them in the timeline.

Catch and handle EntityErrors on Submission
This PR adds a catch block that transforms errors when instantiating a `SubmittableLearningObject` to `ResourceErrors` to avoid sending back a 500 error for a bad submission request.

Extract cleanDocument to shared
This PR moves the cleanDocument function to a new shared module `elasticsearch/HelperFunctions`, as well as renames it to cleanLearningObject.
This is done in preparation for indexing submissions into Elasticsearch in addition to releases.

Add Forbidden Error Response
This PR adds the Forbidden error type as a response, allowing our service to differentiate between "I do not have your credentials" and "I know who you are, but you can't do this".

Remove false positive tests
This PR removes tests that are wrongfully passing due to bad logic in the tests or poorly configured test environment conditions.
After talking with @nvisal1, we also realized that these tests are make assertions about the helper functions they use, not the logic they implement, and therefore should be rewritten. This PR only removes the bad tests, and future work with our test environment will go back to implement new, better tests.

Update learning object to Learning Object
Simple copy change to the home page that seems to have slipped through so far.

Fix revision warning modal
This PR clarifies the context of the disclaimer that is shown when making revisions to a released Learning Object, as well as fixes the bug where the modal showed for all revisions - regardless of whether they are released or not.

Create Versioning.md
This PR adds a new directory to the playbook, called `backend`. Here any standards the team sets should be documented to assist in on-boarding and knowledge transfer.
In the backend directory, a Versioning document has been created to capture standards applied when versioning any service.

Refactor Release Email Integration in Publishing Module
This PR creates a new directory, and refactors the integration of sending an email in the Publishing Module to reduce complexity in `releaseLearningObject`.
Additionally, a development-only bug has been patched.

Run admin unit tests in CI
This PR updates CircleCI config to run tests in the admin module.

Add Launch Scripts for Jest in VS Code
This PR adds two launch scripts from running Jest with VS Code's built in debugger. It was a lot of help with my work on #392, so I figured I'd share.

Write Learning Object Meta to Storage
This PR adds a new publishing artifact, `meta.json`. This file contains all metadata for a Learning Object at the time of publishing a revision, so that we do not have to store data for old revisions in the database.

Change delete to remove
Tiny change here so I figured I would put it in myself. It simply changes the word `delete` to `remove` in the confirmation dialog when deleting a child in the builder.
I think remove is a better candidate here because the user will not permanently lose any data in the operation, they can always add it back.

Improve FileNotFound Download Error
This PR adds error handling logic that will append the file URL that causes a FileNotFound error to happen. This is to help efforts in debugging the error.

Improve FileNotFound Download Error
This PR applies the logic from #122 to the correct area of the system. Download logic is currently duplicated, with the need to deprecate and remove the old route/logic. The previous PR placed the logic in the wrong bundling process.

Fix Status Filter on Admin Dashboard is Not Filtering
This PR moves the ngFor directive onto the list items themselves, instead of creating multiple lists. Click events were not behaving as expected when the context menu contained multiple lists.

Add Tests for Existing Parents Route
This PR adds tests for the current implementation of the Hierarchy Interactor where there were none before.
Next steps will be to update the implementation here for the complexities of revisions.

Fix Details Page Not Displaying Parents' Names
The datastore is returning full `LearningObjects`, so this PR puts the mapping stage back in the route handler.

Fix TSLint Errors
The datastore is currently returning a full Learning Object even when it shouldn't (see #438). This PR adds typecasting in to the route handler that is dealing with this so that `tsc` can run without errors. This restores the `npm start` command.

Fix user resource authentication error
This PR moves the `UserMetaRetriever` Module to the public routes section of the middleware stack to allow visitors to CLARK to load user's profiles.
The `UserMetaRetriever` module does contain a route to access the roles of a user as well, which should in fact be private. This is handled by the existing business logic for the functionality and with these changes still returns a `401` when an unauthenticated party makes a request.

Fix /users/tokens returns a 404
This PR adds a temporary check to the `/users/:username` route handler to forward it's request in the middleware stack if the `username` provided is `tokens`. This is a temporary fix to prevent route collision, and will be removed once we deprecate the `/users/tokens` route in favor of `/users/:username/principal`.

Fix bug with escaped `:` & `=`
As mentioned in [this issue](https://github.com/pvdlg/env-ci/issues/11) parsing fails with:
`SyntaxError: Unexpected token : in JSON` or `SyntaxError: Unexpected token = in JSON`
for TeamCity properties, such as:
```
teamcity.agent.dotnet.agent_url=http\://localhost\:9090/RPC2
teamcity.auth.userId=TeamCityBuildId\=673
```

fix: get tarball name as last line from stdout
some packages, for example [`patch-package`](https://github.com/ds300/patch-package), can print output while `prepare` task, so in order to get right tarball name it's better to get only last line from stdout

TagBase.delete_tags
Context:

We want to resort articles in a board.
To do that we first need to delete them, and re-tag them in the good order.
This should be done regardless of who saved the articles.
Compared to FeedlyUser.delete_tags, which worked on any streamable, and remove all tags that the user calling the method had created, TagBase.delete_tags removes only one tag per article, the tag corresponding to the id of TagBase, and that regardless of the user id.

Setup karma and jasmine for test environment
### Summary

This PR adds karma and jasmine for unit-testing and test coverage. Sample tests are also included.
### Why not jest?
Although Facebook recommends Jest for unit-tesing of react components, it seems like Jest [doesn't work very well  with webpack](https://github.com/facebook/jest/issues/334) (at least I could not make them work together). I've also tried to use some node modules(jest-webpack, jestpack, webpack-babel-jest, jest-webpack-alias tons of them), but also had no luck.
Based on this, I've decided to use good old stack of karma + jasmine.

feature(visualize) avoid overplotting in parameter visualization
Overplotting in `visualize.parameters` can be quite severe when looking at results from a larger number of starts. In this implementation I rescaled the `alpha` according to `min(1,5/clustsize)`. Not 100% happy with the results, any suggestions for improvement are welcome.

Resolve underdetermined SBML export
Not specifying any initial conditions for a species is valid SBML but the resulting model is underdetermined and simulation should fail (it actually does not, as many simulators implement a default value of `0.0`, which is also the case for libroadrunner which is used in the pysb tests). See https://github.com/sbmlteam/sbml-test-suite/issues/54

Fixing issues where users can focus elements inside the dropdown without selecting
## Problem
Using the keyboard a user is able to tab into the dropdown without it being active

## Solution
Adding `display: none` to the subnav means a user will not be able to navigate inside of it until your account has been selected.

Revision of BOT to version v0.3.1
Based on comments received from Antoine Zimmermann [LINK](http://www.semantic-web-journal.net/comment/321#comment-321):

- Removal of cardinality restriction on bot:Interface to ensure BOT stays in OWL RL:
bot:Interface rdfs:subClassOf [
  a owl:Restriction ;
owl:onProperty bot:interfaceOf ;
owl:minCardinality 1 ] .
--> Minor loss vs. huge gain staying in the efficient to reason OWL RL profile
-	Removal of “TODO” language tags
-	Removal of commented axioms

In addition the following minor changes have been applied:
-	Revision of @de labels and comments
-	Addition of W3C CG members as contributors

Release Prep for 1.1.0
This is a changelog and metadata update for the new 1.1.0 release of this module.

Quarterly report addition
The addition of a script to discover quarterly metrics of total PRs created, merged and closed. As it'd only be run once every quarter a couple of things are hardcoded - puppet member list and start and end boundaries of the quarter.

Removal of a breaking test for Xenial
Apt have become less strict in what is allowed when it comes to the key-server options, so this test fails in Ubuntu Xenial. Since it is a test that only covers the functionality of this option in apt itself I am just removing it.

I need to rebase this.

(MODULES-3540) Addition of validate legacy function

Revert "Ensure validate functions use Puppet 4 deprecation"
Reverts puppetlabs/puppetlabs-stdlib#654

Due to problems encountered after merging this code I'm reverting it for the meantime. Due to a modules meetup in Belfast this week I don't have the bandwidth for an immediate fix. I'll create a ticket to look at this whenever I get some time.
Ensure validate functions use Puppet 4 deprecation

Type updates
Includes the addition of several new types inc absolute path, unix path, windows path, https url and http url.
Also includes a fix to some of the current tests for the compat types tests. The puppet version number in the tests was incorrect, and has been changed from > 4.0 to > 4.5.
(MODULES-3393) Deprecation - Use puppet stacktrace if available

(WIP) Puppet 4 Upgrade - First Release Development
This is the (currently WIP) PR for the upgrade of the apt module to Puppet 4 - Including data in modules, EPP templates, the $facts hash, and data types.
Note: The metadata needs updated to a new release of stdlib that isn't yet out - Which will likely cause Travis to go red. Also the Puppet version in metadata will need updated.

(Modules-4320) Readme update for i18n Process
This is prepping the README for translation. Work carried out include
the following:

Values true, false, undef must be wrapped in backticks.
Strings must always be in single quotes.
Sentences must not contain hard returns; they cause the translation
software to create new paragraphs.
For code blocks, use triple backticks (```) and the name of the
language. Without language highlighting, the backticks get stripped out.
Also, language highlighting is nice.
Standardize exceptions to default values (for example, Default value:
'/etc/ntp.conf' (Solaris: '/etc/inet/ntp.conf').)

(FM-6170) Addition of branch check for build number creation
The build ID on the release pipelines were occasionally causing the builds to break due to having the same or an already existing build number on master job. This PR provides the addition of a simple branch check followed by adding an 'r' to the release branch jobs - ensuring the conflict doesn't happen again.
(MODULES-4833) Update to Puppet version dependancy #puppethack

Ensure release allows empty strings
Ensures $release now accepts empty strings as a value without failing and addition of test

Adding a parent rake task for i18n of a module
This will be the parent rake task to call all i18n rake tasks for a module to get it prepared for internationalisation. Note that it is inside the check to ensure the module has a locales directory - a sign that the module is i18n ready.

MODULES-5047 - Update java::oracle class to work with new download URLs
Oracle appears to have changed the JDK URL structure starting with Java 8u121.
This update adds a hash to store the values used by Oracle's java download site
along with a case statement to lookup the proper key for the java release being
installed.
(WIP) String wrapper for Ruby and rake task for i18n prep

Allows file paths to be used as well as file names for Ruby Rewrite.
Previously Ruby Rewrite would only work when a file name was passed in. The addition of these changes now allows for file paths without affecting the old functionality.

Move class test to run first for Debian 9

This PR doesn't work in conjunction with three of the older OSes, SLES11, Redhat5 and Centos5.
As a result I'm taking this back out.

[FM-7504] - Put a conditional around Winrm version
Due to a new version of Winrm being released that has a higher Ruby dependency (>=2.2.0)
installations of Bolt are failing on Puppet 4, considering that Puppet 4 ships with Ruby 1.9.0.
This is an attempt to fix this issue by pinning to the last version of winrm that will work with older Ruby,
while allowing newer versions to install the latest 2.x release.

[MODULES-8476] Several code cleanup tasks
Update test runs to be under the acceptance namespace
Remove formatting around rspec output which wasn't required
Remove 'all' option from solid waffle, tests now may only run in parrallel or individually.

(MODULES-8553) Further cleanup for package tag issues
Update all this modules tagged packages to use 'puppetlabs-postgresql' instead of just 'postgresql' which is ambiguous and causing dependancy issues.
(MODULES-8717) Move testing from task_helper to BoltSpec & Fix BoltSpec dependency issue

(MODULES-8717) Fix dependency issue on boltspec
Moving the requires causing dependancy issues to the spec_helper_acceptance so they don't conflict with each other.

This is a rebase of the work done in https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-puppet_metrics_collector/pull/6 with the addition of a splunk_hec option.
All comments in the original PR should have hopefully been addressed.

Add "overrides" analyzer
Should fix #36.
DO NOT MERGE YET!
Opening a pull request to check that this is how you want it implemented, it is not yet compete (only handles methods for now).
These changes add an analyzer for methods that checks what method they override from, ask asked for in issue #36. Say a class `A` has a virtual method named `Method`, and a class `B` inherits from `A` and overrides `B`, and a third class `C` does the same to `B`, the output would be as seen in [this screenshot](http://i.imgur.com/SkTjsQC.png).
I'm not sure if naming and code style are correct (and to be honest I'm not sure about the implementation of `CanShow()` either), which is why I'm opening this pull request early.

Target both .NET Fx 3.5 and .NET Std 2.0 in dnlib.netstandard.csproj (closes #177)
This change makes it so that the dnlib.netstandard.csproj file produces both .NET 3.5 and .NET Standard 2.0 binaries, and technically makes the original csproj obsolete (you need VS2017 for C# 7.2 anyway). This change also allows you to easily create a NuGet package on build that includes both versions using this csproj.
See issue #177. Also note that this isn't the Client version of .NET 3.5.
To build the .NET Standard version with .NET Core, use `dotnet build dnlib.netstandard.csproj -f netstandard2.0` now instead of `dotnet build dnlib.netstandard.csproj`.

Enhance Positioning Options for Tooltips & Popovers
### Summary:
Add more positioning options to the **tooltip** component, using _tether_'s native [attachment options](http://tether.io/#attachment). As requested in #17759 and #19921, and inspired by [semantic UI tooltips](https://semantic-ui.com/modules/popup.html#tooltip). No breaking changes, still fully support previous params. Docs updated accordingly.
### Before:
Tooltips supported only 4 positioning options: top | right | bottom | left

### After:
Tooltips now have an **optional** secondary alignment option, for example `top left` or `right bottom`, summing up in 12 positioning options.

Add qr selection test
Added a test to ensure MessagePair, SignaturePair and signing/decoding stay functional and consistent between Wallet app and Usher app.
After test was complete a bug in reconstructing the signature was discovered - if the top byte in the signature is zero, upon reconstruction the signature length is 64, since we send the signature as a base10 decimal. This was fixed.
Also, more meaningful static constant names were given in the class for how the selection is interpreted, and to ensure the lengths can't ever mismatch if they need to be changed.

Switch transaction listeners to use the internal contract events. This saves users a lot of bandwidth and makes the code cleaner.

Simplify token update
Quick update which simplifies the token update code. It also fixes an old bug that only manifested after switching networks to Rinkeby and consequently having very fast blockchain query times.

Use Stormbird node as primary
Apply Weiwu's suggestion to use Stormbird eth node as primary, Infura as backup if the primary node is unresponsive. This gives a big performance boost and is safe as we automatically switch to backup if primary goes down.

Remove blocking get
After investigating a crash report and doing some testing it was determined the 'blockingGet' introduced to serialise the transaction processing (and to stop the fetcher from processing a huge number of threads simultaneously) was causing problems - this was especially noticeable when all the libraries were upgraded to the latest releases.
Fix includes restricting the get to a fixed pool of threads, so as not to overload the phone with an auxiliary task (populating contract transactions).

Add token service transaction display

Fix Geth signature generation
The Android Geth service uses the default/bitcoin EC signing style, with correction byte ('V') either 0 or 1. Ethereum nodes can accept both this styles and RFC6979 style.
Metamask uses the RFC6979 format (V = 0x1b/0x1c) and some DApps eg Chibifighters.io only support this format.
Many DApp sign checking code are compatible with both formats eg Cryptokitties - however since developers test against Metamask the signing style needs to be identical to this.
This PR converts the signature produced by Geth when signing a pre-formed hash.

The areas where problems are likely to show have had crashalytics logs attached so we should be able to get some feedback if these are triggering.

Find network for import
On token import, if the wallet isn't by default set to the right network, or if there's no Token Definition for the token being imported, the wallet will scan the networks to try to find the contract.
Check order is:

1. Is there an XML definition for the contract? If yes, use this network.
2. Check for 'name' for the target contract on the current network.
3. Try 'name' for the target contract on all known networks. If found switch to that network.
Now user doesn't need to pre-select the network, improving UX flow for any magiclink operation.

Multi chain support
This branch is the culmination of the Multi Chain support project.
The goal of the project is to remove the concept of 'active network', and view all networks simultaneously.
Also to more reliably discover tokens on accounts and refactor the wallet internal code to be more reliable and robust, taking a step toward an Alphawallet 'core' where the wallet UI and other applications interact with a platform agnostic service.

Fix for URL crash when certain URLs are added
When copy/pasting a URL containing base64 param such as:

`https://jamboard.google.com/d/3x33DeFGe0cAch3G0TMugg13D1o93gIpgcll3s/viewer?f=4`

into the dapp browser, the app would crash in the base64 decoder while trying to decode what it thought was a base64.
Move the decode into the exception handled zone, then if it's not a magic link it'll throw, the function will return a null and the app will proceed normally.

As reported by @zhangzhongnan928 on the Telegram group.
It was impossible to scroll down on a website that was slightly longer than the screen height as this gesture was intercepted as a screen refresh event.
This PR makes the swipe refresh event detection less sensitive; specifically to trigger it you need to swipe downward more than 400 pixels within 300ms. These figures were arrived at by collecting swipe gesture pattern data; typically a swipe refresh fling gesture lasts only 100ms and will be well over 500 pixels. Using the more generous data still allows easy refresh but lets through browser scrolling.

Fix standard eth transaction
Addressing #745, standard ETH dapp transactions have never been supported.
Logic was changed to ensure all types of Dapp transaction are handled correctly, and also added a 'check contract' button in the confirmation screen so the user can check the contract they're calling on etherscan.

Display share instruction
Ensure that something happens when share is clicked even when there's nothing to share.
Fixes #754

Catch and display Dapp data errors
Added diagnostic error display for Dapp developers. If signing message is malformed the resulting exception will be caught and displayed as an error message.

Fix for using metamask address
Fix importing metamask EIP681 address QR code.

Add required types for tokenscript
Fix for tokenscript native send function (determine correct send address) and add tokens which are defined in debug tokenscript to tokens list.
Fixes #814

Fix using correct name in injected tokenscript properties
Fixes #812 , check if tokenscript defines a token name and use that in the injected token properties.

Fix to initial wallet creation
Fixes a reported issue where sometimes no Ethereum main net balance card appears when first creating a wallet, until another refresh is done.
Was caused by a race condition as the main page would be started twice - a background thread fetching the balance would be interrupted by the second instance of the main page, leading to the tokens service getting refreshed part way through clashing with the return from the second instance of the balance update.

Fix issue where sometimes the webview doesn't display
This PR fixes an issue where Android had deprecated or changed the internal code to load data directly into the webview. The issue manifests by sometimes seeing 'no data' in the function webview, especially in newer phones using Android 9. It is most likely due to certain data sequences not rendering correctly and triggering an exception.

Fix tokenscript contract handling
Fixes Tokenscript defined smart contract function call with user-input base currency value.
Visible as:
- tokenscript call incorrectly sending raw currency when there was a function call.
- Incorrect description of transaction in confirmation page.

Add convenience methods for use in Ethereum libraries
- Add constructor to initialise a uint256 from a hex string.
- Add export_bits to uint256 to export fixed length 32 byte vector.
- Add export_bits_truncate to export fitted byte vector.

Token script certificate check
Check Tokenscripts using the API call to /v1/verifyXMLDSig.
Allow user to click on XML and TSML files in chat apps/email to import directly into AlphaWallet.

Show pending transactions
- Show pending transactions pushed from the wallet in the main transaction view and the recent transactions view.

Fix signing and upgrade on unlocked phones
User couldn't get past upgrade/sign dialog on unlocked phone.
Fixes #847.

Override EIP681 network select if user already chose network.
Only change chain for EIP681 requests if scanning from outside the send page.
If we're scanning inside the send page then we already selected the network from the main wallet page and don't want that choice overridden.
Fixes #851

Fix for sendUncheckedTransaction freeze issue
Fixes #846. Callback was using incorrect return type and not actually passing any data.

Fix import token using gas
Ensure we have auth to use gas to import tokens from magiclink.
The PR fixes an issue where authentication wasn't obtained before attempting to use gas, so the transaction sign errored.

Ensure Tokenscript functions appear correctly
- Fix for NFT button bar appearance with multiple actions.

Refactor Action Button bar 
This PR refactors the action button bar which had got a bit messy. Created a new drop-in class that's a single drop-in and setup for any screen using TokenScript actions.

Allow network connection to timeout if it can't connect.
Observed in China.
OKHttp connection was held open and repeatedly tried when it was going to always fail.

Add ownerAddress to injected token values
Adds the required ownerAddress to injected token properties.

Fix: changes not loaded from onConfirm callback & add more input types 
- Fix for different types of input.
- ensure 'onConfirm' is called before evaluating input types.

Ensure complete wallet object is passed
Issue discovered during testing. Using the 'long press' method on the token view, send/transfer on the bottom bar appear. When you click on these we need to pass the whole wallet object to the next activity so that any signing works.
Note: depending on which wallet type you have, signing works differently - HD Key, Keystore, Keystore legacy, Watch. This is why the whole wallet object was passed. This bug was in since the HD Key overhaul, but only affects ERC875, and only when you use the long press to pop up the send/transfer buttons.

Fix token titles
- Strip garbage characters from token name if name specified in bytes type rather than string type.
- If token has a very long balance (eg 19999944475) then split the name onto the next line to avoid display appearing cluttered.
(Both points noticed when handling a token with some bad characters in the name and a very large balance, FYI: Rinkeby 0x8D8Df3Ec3ca5D0b23F465754830B866238c43B7e).

Additional features
• Use only high variance genes for speed up at the cost of some performance.
• Can specify values for additional parameters used by Phenograph.

v1.1 High Variance Genes
• Use only high variance genes for speed up at the cost of some performance.
• Can specify values for additional parameters used by Phenograph.

V1.2 Hypergeometric p-Values
• Better performance calling doublets by computing a p-value from hypergeometric testing on the level of synthetic doublet enrichment in each cluster.
• Multiple runs can be specified to produce significantly better p-values. Our recommendation, and the default setting, is 5 runs.
Closes #18.

Exclude unclustered cells from deciding doublets.
Unclustered cells receive 'np.NaN' for their score and p-value.
Resolves #48.

Voting scheme
Updates classification methodology: cells with p-value > 0.99 on at least 90% of iterations are called doublets. Both thresholds are parameters to `.fit` (these are the default values).
Updates `n_iters`, `n_top_var_genes`, and `phenograph_parameters` defaults to be in line with updated methodology.

Installable Packaging
Provides typical python package installation.

v2.0 API Stablized
Finalizes all public facing parameters, methods, and attributes.
Includes removing many. Be sure to check the fully updated docstrings.

Set phenograph parameter 'prune'=True by default.
User must specifically pass 'prune': False in phenograph_parameters to change this.

Crf core demo
- Correct EPSUM calculation to include all edges a node is party to (really this time).
- Update startup.m to include scripts folder.

Conforms to #68 when n_iters == 1
Ensures .labels_ is np.nan for cells that fail to join a cluster.
Propose to close #68 with this, as the warning it references is long gone anyway.

Fast(er) Normalize
Optimizes the default normalization method by memoizing the normalized `raw_counts`.
Also improves the install process robustness, and ensures consistent labeling of cells that join no cluster when `n_iters == 1`.

Log p-values
- p-values now the result of hypergeometric test for over-representation, not under-representation
- internally calculate and work with log p-values
- add all_log_p_values_ attribute
- threshold plot to evaluate solutions at different threshold levels
- updated notebook

Verbosity
Adds `verbose` parameter so user can tell doubletdetection to be silent.
Only open question is do we want some improved granularity on message presentation? Fairly straight forward to do with `logging`, but is it worthwhile, @adamgayoso?
Closes #64 either way.
